intro: Brossaea antarctica, commonly known as the Antarctic brossaea, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and narrow, fleshy leaves. Brossaea antarctica is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including cold temperatures and strong winds.
